Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.GUIControllers

Class GameLobbyController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.GUIControllers.GUIController
it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.GUIControllers.GameLobbyController
public class GameLobbyController extends GUIController
This class is responsible for controlling the game lobby in the GUI. It extends the GUIController class.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLobbyController

      public GameLobbyController()

  • Method Details

    • rulebookButton

      public void rulebookButton()
      Handles the action for the rulebook button. It toggles the visibility and enabled state of the rulebook and players panes.

    • nextRulebookSlide

      public void nextRulebookSlide()
      Handles the action for the next rulebook slide button. It selects the next slide in the rulebook tab pane and disables the next button when the last slide is reached.

    • previousRulebookSlide

      public void previousRulebookSlide()
      Handles the action for the previous rulebook slide button. It selects the previous slide in the rulebook tab pane and disables the back button when the first slide is reached.

    • update

      public void update(Object update)
      Updates the game lobby based on the given update object. It updates the visibility and enabled state of each player pane and label based on the players in the game.
      Overrides:
      update in class GUIController
      Parameters:
      update - The object representing the update.

    • setReadyButton

      public void setReadyButton()
      Handles the action for the set ready button. It sets the player as ready and updates the ready players label.

    • quitGame

      public void quitGame()
      Handles the action for the quit game button. It displays the exit pane.

    • noExitButton

      public void noExitButton()
      Handles the action for the no exit button. It hides the exit pane.

    • yesExitButton

      public void yesExitButton()
      Handles the action for the yes exit button. It quits the game, initializes the viewGUI, interrupts the wait thread, and changes the scene to the lobby.

    • sceneInitializer

      public void sceneInitializer()
      Initializes the scene by adding all player names and panes to their respective lists. It then retrieves the current game from the viewGUI and updates the game lobby. Finally, it starts a new thread that waits for the game to start and then changes the scene to the game.
      Overrides:
      sceneInitializer in class GUIController
